channel.title: How would you pass UID verification?
channel.description: I know this is what you have to do to use a modified client. So how would you do this? Where is it handled? Etc. thanks.

item.title: How would you pass UID verification?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

How does the UID have anything to do with what you are talking about? It is some stupid way kids try and prevent cheat clients and hackers from busting their balls, you can easily get around it by adding it to your logic protocol.

Now if we are talking about the real UID, I am sure no one has found good use for it.

Read full topic
item.source: How would you pass UID verification?

item.title: How would you pass UID verification?
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Would this work on an existing server/client?

Server sided:

if (clientVersionUID = newClientVersionUID) {
handleOtherSentBytes();
}

And client sided, handling to send bytes.

Read full topic

item.title: How would you pass UID verification?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:5, topic:418339”]Since when is UID verification located in stream?[/quote]stream.java holds some stuff with the RSA modules if it’s added if the information in that is incorrect you can’t connect.

Read full topic
item.source: How would you pass UID verification?

item.title: How would you pass UID verification?
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

Best thing to do would be to enable the RSA encryption and distribute the public key with your client and keep private with the server. That’s how Runescape prevents cheat clients. Just make sure you change the key set now and then. This also will make your connection secure (preventing others from sniffing the packets). Or if you want to be lazy just have the client send a byte after the byte (255) which comes after the login block size indication byte.

Read full topic
item.source: How would you pass UID verification?
